translations.translation: What you have been promised is sheer nonsense!
How far-fetched what you are promised;
Far-fetched, utterly far-fetched is what you are being promised.
Such a promise will never come true.
“How remote, (really) how remote is the promise you are given!”
Far, very far is that which you are promised!"
Far, far is that which you are threatened with.
Away, away with that you are promised!
Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!
What you are promised is indeed far-fetched.
Away! away with that wherewith ye are promised;
Far-fetched, far-fetched is what you are promised!
Far, very far is that which ye are promised!
Far, very far is that which you are promised.
After, after with that which you are promised!
Farfetched, farfetched is what you are promised.
How far, how far, is that which you are promised.

[23:36] Far-fetched, far-fetched (hayhāt is a noun of action in the past tense, functioning as a verbal noun, meaning ba‘uda ba‘uda, ‘far from it, far from it!’) is what you are promised!, in the way of being brought forth from the graves (li-mā: the lām is extra, for explication).
(Be gone, be gone, with that which ye are promised!) how farfetched, how farfetched! This will never be.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ } معناه ما أبعد ذَلكَ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ } أي: بَعُد بعداً تاماً، واستحال استحالةً شديدةً { لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ } [المؤمنون: 36] من البعث بعد الموت والوجود بعد العدم والإعادة بعد الإماتة
